intro: Psychotria macrophylla var. angustissima, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
